Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello hello. Top of the morning to you! Ooh ooh! Green M&Ms! Nature's Viagra! [Grabs and pours Kevin-esque scoop of M&Ms into his coat pocket] Two of my favorite joke areas combined. It'll be a good day.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I don't want to bring my friends, why can't it just be the two of us?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Because it's St. Patrick's Day, people go out in groups.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well why don't you invite your friends?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why are you being so weird about this?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Stop fighting. Just on St Patrick's Day, okay? Just one perfect day a year. No hassles, no problems, no kids.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Why no kids?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Yeah, where are your kids?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nope. Nuh -uh. Not today!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is St. Patrick's Day, and here in Scranton that is a huge deal. It is the closest that the Irish will ever get to Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Welcome back, "Dad!"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Welcome back Tuna!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey... [reveal Dwight's Mega-Desk]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very good. Okay. Will get back to you right away on that, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do we got here?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mega-Desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Of course.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Command central.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hm hm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Surveillance, gaming- and business.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. [Pulls desks apart] Just gotta...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. Come on! Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dweedle Dee and Dweedle Dumb-ass have been away on maternity leave. Now Dweedle Dumb-ass is back, and we have a problem. Yes, getting hooked on Mega-Desk was my own damn fault. But ... I don't care about assigning blame. All I care about is Mega-Desk. That is all I care about. Getting. More. Mega-Desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh, I love this, so much fun! There's such team spirit in this room! 'Morning Darling!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Morning!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, this is my last day at the Scranton branch for a while. But I'm leaving it in the very capable hands of some of the loveliest people I've ever had the pleasure of knowing. Oh I'm gonna miss this place. And the snow! Hoo, my dogs love peeing in that snow! Makes me think they're onto something.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh good morning sweetheart.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Morning, honey-pile.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I'm sorry but is that a gift I see in your hands?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is. This is a little something for you to remember your time here in Scranton by.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [pulls out glass cube with coal.] Is that a lump of coal?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it is!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Have I been that naughty?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no no- that is a good gift actually. Buildings here in Scranton are literally powered by coal.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Err, thank you very much. We, we don't get to see much coal in Tallahassee, I'm used to alligators, and some of the worst Chinese food you've ever tasted.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm, that sounds great, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, if you ever get down in my neck of the woods, you got a place to stay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When you work for Sabre, only one thing matters. And I don't care if you're a loser, or you practice bestiality, if Jo likes you, you are in. And I am in!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin go braugh!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy go braugh to you! Nice kilt!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thanks. It's actually my sister's old field hockey skirt.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin and I have our first date tonight, and it has to be perfect. Why? Because according to "How I Met Your Mother" that's the date that your kids are going to wait patiently to hear about, and you better have a good story for them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. [re-enters bullpen from kitchen.]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you. [hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No-no-no-no-no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh come on. Come on. Five more minutes? Five more minutes of Mega-Desk? Please?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [swats over various photos and knickknacks, points at paperwork] Is this yours or mine?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They say that no man is an island. False! I am an island and this island is volcanic. And it is about to erupt. With the molten hot lava of strategy!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good Lord! [Photo of Cece on Jim's desktop] I can't believe I'm missing this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's kind of like that lip thing she did last night, like a half snarl, half smile? I get the sense that she's very ironic.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Love you. We'll talk soon. [hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Must be amazing being a father right, a miracle of life?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It is. Big time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah, that baby is just discovering the whole wide world right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pretty amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What up is, what down is, who Mom is, who Dad is. Must be tough being here with all that going on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh it's tough being here for a lot of reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I mean, you're here at work, and the baby thinks that the refrigerator is its father.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that what happened to you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll tell you what happened to me. I didn't see my father for the first two years of my life. I thought my mother was my father, and my wet-nurse was my mother.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's a common mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Turned out fine for me. But Mose? Oh. Same story, different ending.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey! [Erin sneezing at desk] Are you sick?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, no I'm fine, I just have a little indigestion.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: In your nose?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes. [Angela returns to desk and puts embroidered breathing mask on]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm a little sick but I don't want to miss my date with Andy. I'll get better. Whenever I'm sick it goes away within a few hours. Except once, when I was in the hospital from age three to six.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Now, after all the talking I've been doing. It's your turn. This is a town hall meeting. I want to hear what you all sound like.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is a great idea JB.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Thank you. You know I get way too many ideas from the top. Now I want to hear your ideas. I mean, did you guys know that Liquid Paper? That wasn't invented by some fancy engineer. No, that was created by a lowly typist.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jo, I have an idea, for suntan lotion - soap.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: You know it doesn't have to be an invention.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I have a question.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, homosexual accountant.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: In the training manual it says, that there is a minority executive training program in Tallahassee?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I am so proud of Sabre's "Print In All Colors" initiative. Any Sabre employee of color, is welcome to apply. [Kelly applauds] Daryl?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Daryl. Mellow, soulful, smart for warehouse...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Okay hush now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: The Sabre shipping method could be more efficient. Combining inventory systems makes sense on paper, but printers and paper ship differently. It'll be faster to deliver them separately, instead of waiting on everything to come in.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: But you wouldn't need more trucks?

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Not at all. There's a way that it can be scheduled. I sketched this out downstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh look at you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look at that picture that you drew. Nice job! We're very proud of you. You know what, we're gonna tape that up on the refrigerator in the kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: [Looks over his proposal] I like this Daryl. I like this a lot. Maybe you should be doing your sketching upstairs. Would you like an office up here?

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yeah. Take Jim's old office.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Um. I set my stuff up in there. So... just give me a few minutes to clean that out for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yeah, I want to hear more from you.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Okay. Any questions? Anything on anybody's mind? I'm leaving tonight, this is your last chance for a while!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh no! Say it's not so, Jo, we're gonna miss you, we're gonna miss you so much!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yes, well okay. Florida ain't that far away.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I am heading down there.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, anytime now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How about July 4th weekend? [Reveals paper ticket]

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh honey you didn't buy a ticket?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh honey. I'm not home, very often. And uh, me and my relatives, they take up the guesthouse. I think you should check with my office, before you book any dates, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, in the spirit of full disclosure, I have actually reserved a bunch of different seats on a bunch of different flights, but there are a couple of flights that only have two tickets left, so I think we should pull the trigger and -

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Enough!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, everybody, just try to put a brave face on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's follow the chain of events. Jo likes Michael. Jo invites Michael to house. Jo doesn't like Michael anymore. Hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: [singing] Moving on up, to the East Side, to the deluxe apartment in the sky...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello. I want you to stop what you're doing right now. You are stressed, and I'm taking you to lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: No, that's very generous of you, but I'm all set.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No is not an option.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yes it is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right. Well if you need me, I'll be on the other side of that wall. Knock once for yes, twice for no.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: How many knocks does it take to get you to do some work?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] I'll be over there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I'm actually pleased to be able to offer you printer cartridges and toner now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Whispers] Oh Jim, Jim! Sorry to bother you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My headphones are broken.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I listen to my music at a low volume?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah that's great. Great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay? [Unplugs cord, sings] "The cat's in the cradle and the silver spoon, little boy blue-"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Overlapping] When's the last time you upgraded your printer?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "- and the man in the moon. When you coming home Dad? I don't know when-"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Whispers] Please stop that!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "-But we'll be together then-"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can you grow up?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "-Dad, you know we'll have a good time then."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Turns off Dwight's music] Whether it's this time or next time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Vocalizes and continues song] "The cat's in the cradle and the silver spoon"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [On business call] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Dwight
Quote.Text: [Singing, Dwight supplies beats] "Little boy blue and the man in the moon."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, we definitely can talk about it in the next-

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Dwight
Quote.Text: "When you coming home Dad?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, can I call you back?

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Dwight
Quote.Text: "I don't know when-"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That would be great, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy and Dwight
Quote.Text: "But we'll get together then, we're gonna have a good time-"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [On phone in hallway] No, I know I need to work, I just- I feel weird not being home.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am not surprised that Dwight's using my baby to steal my desk. I'm a little surprised that it's working.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: This fax came for you. [Coughs]

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh no no no! Are you feeling ill?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh no honey, if you got a bug, I want you to go on home. I can't have you getting Callie and Jo Jr. sick. These dogs have got to be in a commercial with Dwight Howard next week.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh! No. I feel like I could lift a car.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yeah, but you sound like death, girl. Now why don't you go on home and take care of yourself and get in bed. And shred that and have them send me a clean fax, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well... [Jo closes door on her]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She should go home. It's not the end of the world. We'll go on our date next week. She's still gonna like me in a week. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was just working at my desk and I wanted to run some new leads by you. [Turns feint]

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh! You're sick! [Andy coughs] Dangit! That's exactly why I sent that receptionist home.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Get everybody sick in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I have some good ideas...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: We don't need any heroes here honey. It's time for you to get on home now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You sure?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: You'll probably feel better once you get some pants on. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Very nice.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Not bad, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A real Hoop Dreams story you got there. Oh man, you seem to have caught Jo's eye. How'd you make that happen?

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: I impressed her with my good ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hm mm. Seriously, how did you do it?

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: I made a suggestion at the meeting that was good. You were there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How do I put this delicately? Does her family owe your family something, in terms of a past injustice?

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Now Mike, I have to ask you to leave, so that I can learn about this tiny television.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. All right.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Hey there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey there. So I think I'm done. Gonna head out. Unless you want to chat. Like we were doing earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well there's chatting time and there's working time. I'm still on working time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm? Well, the clock says chatting time, so.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well, if you feel like you've done a solid days work...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right. What?

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well I mean, if you can put your name on this day, and be proud of the amount of work you've done, then, by all means, you should toodle on home.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm. mm. Oh well.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Anything else I can help you with?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. That's super-clear-ish. [Exits, closes door, takes off coat.] Nope. Nope. Nope. Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Just because Jo has no life, does not mean that the rest of us don't have lives. Oscar has a life. I think Ryan has a life. This is outrageous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Pack-man.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hey what's up, Butt-plug?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How you doing stud? You already there?

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Dude, I've been here since three! I've boot and rallied twice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How's the lady situation?

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Fat and ugly. You might actually have a chance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah damn. That sounds great. Unfortunately I am stuck here, because my boss is making us work late.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Oh here's what you do. Hike up your skirt and pull out your tampon, borrow some balls and come meet me!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Maybe next year.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Maybe next "queer." Hey ladies, who wants some bangers and mash?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [Opens door, surprised] Oh! Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm in my jammy-jams!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's okay, I'm in my "worky-works." You look amazing!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. Come in!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey! Me and Creed are in. Are you guys in?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm in.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: All right. [The four of them get out of chairs to run out, Jo exits her office. They retreat.]

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Oh, you don't become the most powerful woman in Tallahassee by slacking off. [Scoffs] You do it by working hard. Or marrying rich. I did both!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah. Got a little client meeting at Shanny O'Gannigan's tonight. It shouldn't go all night long, so if you'd like me to, I could swing by your house so the baby can experience a strong male presence. [Jim is silent] No? Nothing? Okay. Have fun working. [Whistles "Cat's in the Cradle" song]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi there Jo. Sorry to interrupt. Um, this evening [phone rings] I have...

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey Jo, it's Jim Halpert. I actually scheduled a meeting at 7:30 with a very important client. And it's so weird, because we never have meetings after 5pm. But I was hoping that maybe just this once, it would be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Well sure. You know, you go ahead and push some printers.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know I will. And by the way, seriously, we never, never do this!

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Sorry Sugar. What'd you want?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, you see, I actually do have a meeting. With a client. I'm just gonna reschedule for next week.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [pops back into Jo's doorway] Thanks again by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Hey! What are you fellas doing up here?

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse guy 1
Quote.Text: We're here to bust you out!

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: I wish, but uh-

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse guy 1
Quote.Text: Dude! Your shirt tucked in?

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Oh. Yeah, um, I must have did that when I was in the bathroom. All right then, uh, let me get to it.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse guy 1
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Warehouse guy 2
Quote.Text: See you later.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Your hand's cold.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It is? I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, have some more blanket.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Reid
Quote.Text: What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're awake. Andy, this is my brother, Reid.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I didn't know you had a brother.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He's my foster brother.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, any brother of Erin's is a friend of mine. Nice to meet you. Andy Bernard. [They shake hands]

Quote.Speaker: Reid
Quote.Text: Cold hands. [Takes spot next to Erin on love seat]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are we rotating seats, or?

Quote.Speaker: Reid
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, you're the guest. Take the easy chair, best seat in the house. Plus, you don't have to sit next to this big dork and her smelly feet.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey! My feet aren't smelly, they smell like roses. Smell them! [puts her feet in his face]

Quote.Speaker: Reid
Quote.Text: Ooh! [Erin giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So, how does the whole foster sibling thing work? Do you guys share one parent or-?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: None. We were in the same house from ages ten to twelve. And then from fifteen to eighteen.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right. Formative years. [She laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Reid
Quote.Text: Nice skirt.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's a kilt.

Quote.Speaker: Night cleaning crew
Quote.Text: Oh! Sorry! Sorry, sorry. [They retreat. Pan around office still full with staff.]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm anxious to get off work. But let me be clear. It's not to celebrate St Patrick's Day. It's so I can protest St. Patrick's Day.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Overnight all my damn bags home. I'm carrying nothing but my Sable gloves. I've had it with Homeland Security. And I want you to put all those tracking numbers in my Blackberry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How late do we have to work tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You never know with Jo. Sometimes we're here til midnight. Sometimes she doesn't show up for three days.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why does she do that? Why doesn't she just tell you what your schedule is?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah, that would be awesome. I could get a girlfriend. Wouldn't have to go to Amsterdam seven times a year. But uh, I'm young, right? I will date when I'm dead! [Laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I really want to turn out like Gabe? Twenty-six. Single. Tied to my desk. No life, no family. I want to have been married by the time I would've turned thirty. That's just - that's just depressing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello Jo.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Anything I can do for you Puddin'?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There is, as a matter of fact. It's getting sorta late. It's 8:30. And it's St. Patrick's Day, which is a world ethnic holiday. So I have decided I'm going to dismiss my employees.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm thrilled with the work they've done today, both quality and the quantity. Great performance, Very, very solid all the way around.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: All right then.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Happy St. Patrick's Day. [Starts to leave office] And also, I would like to say that I will be canceling my trip down to Tallahassee. Although I do look forward to our professional relationship.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jo
Quote.Text: I look forward to that too.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ooh. It's coming down out there.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes. Thank you, for coming all the way here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry I was so sick. [Andy leans in. She leans in. Reid appears in background. Erin kisses Andy on the cheek.]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ah. Oh great, now I'm gonna get sick. [They both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excuse me, excuse me. Hey guys!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith, Creed, Oscar and Matt
Quote.Text: [cheering Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Drinks are on me!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No! No, no no! Put your credit cards away. Drinks are on us!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh -hoh! All right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did I mess up my career today? My future prospects at Sabre? I don't know. There is a chance. Yes. I tell you I love my job. But Jo wants me to put on a show for her, and pretend to work late? Nah. I spent all day, trying to make her like me, and I forgot to ask myself something:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. We should be able to have that right over to you by Monday. Yeah no problem. [Reveal Jim behind Quad-Desk] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What the hell is this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is not Mega-Desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it's not. They call it Quad-Desk.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's ridiculous, this is made up of three desks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God. We're going to have to re-name it then aren't we? [Dwight's phone rings. He crawls into nook under Jim's Quad-Desk]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello, Dwight Schrute?
